albums.title: All These Are The Days
albums.process: An experimental album using tape cassette degradation as a primary technique, manipulating the tape to create saturation and distortion.This process results in a deliberately broken, imperfect sound that highlights the beauty of analog decay.

albums.title: The Field of Living
albums.process: Combining household objects to create melodies and ambiances alongside instrumental music, this album blends organic and experimental elements, capturing a raw, unrefined sonic experience.

albums.title: Sun & Ice
albums.process: Emphasizing field recordings, this album creates an atmospheric backdrop for instrumental music. The integration of location-based sounds with composed elements sets a context for the music, offering a narrative that connects sound to environment.

albums.title: The After Mountain
albums.process: This album features cyclical re-amping of spatialized audio to generate complex, organic textures. The audio is re-spatialized in a 5-speaker setup and recorded binaurally. Physical movement is embedded within the layers as the recordings evolve.

albums.title: Waiting Spaces
albums.process: Focused on reamping sound through unconventional objects like underwater and metallic structures, this album examines how physical mediums can transform and reshape audio, creating a rich sonic landscape filled with texture and depth.

albums.title: Wanderlust II
albums.process: An album that integrates tape loops, hydrophones, and binaural recordings to evoke a sense of place and immersion. These elements combine to create an acoustic journey, blending natural and synthetic sounds while exploring the boundaries between environment and sound.

albums.title: Timelines
albums.process: This album explores the process of cyclical re-amping, where sounds are linked to specific spaces and played back repeatedly. The resulting audio is manipulated through multiple iterations, creating a layered composition that captures the unique sonic character of each space.
